intro: Eleocharis loefgreniana, commonly known as the Hawaiian sedge, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy environments, often in coastal or inland wetlands. It has slender, grass-like stems and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
